FuncDef:
The export msdp command enables the function of transmitting (S, G) entry information in BGP Source Active A-D routes to the rendezvous point (RP) through Multicast Source Discovery Protocol (MSDP) Source Active (SA) messages.
The undo export msdp command restores the default configuration. The export msdp command enables the function of transmitting (S, G) entry information in BGP Source Active A-D routes to the rendezvous point (RP) through Multicast Source Discovery Protocol (MSDP) Source Active (SA) messages. The undo export msdp command restores the default configuration. By default, (S, G) entry information in BGP Source Active A-D routes are not transmitted to the RP through MSDP SA messages. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
ParentView: VPN instance IPv4 address family MVPN view
ExtraInfo: If PIM-SM MDT setup does not span MVPN tunnels, an RP can be deployed on a PE or CE. If a CE is configured as an RP, the CE needs to establish an MSDP peer relationship with its connected PE. To transmit the (S, G) entry information learned through the BGP Source Active A-D route to the remote CE, run the export msdp command.
